translated: Birth Stories
The Group of Fives🔽The Chapter about the Ascending Scale of Beauty
The Birth Story of Mittavindaka
“What have I done to the gods,
what evil have I done?
That a wheel has fallen on my head
and is spinning on my head.”
“Having passed over the delightful,🔽the ever-intoxicating, and the Dūbha palace,
and the Brahmā-like palace,
for what purpose have you come here?”
“Here there are more possessions,
I think they will be there;
With this perception,
see me gone to destruction.”
“From the four, the eight arose,
from the eight, the sixteen;
from the sixteen, the thirty-two,
the wheel struck the greedy one;
For the one who is struck by desire,
the wheel spins on the head.
The upper roof is hard to fill,
desire goes to the scattered one;
And those who follow it,
they become wheel-bearers.”
The Birth Story of Mittavindaka, the ninth.
